00001 #ifndef SASS_MEMORY_MANAGER_H
00002 #define SASS_MEMORY_MANAGER_H
00003 
00004 #include <vector>
00005 #include <iostream>
00006 
00007 namespace Sass {
00008   using namespace std;
00010   // A class for tracking allocations of AST_Node objects. The intended usage
00011   // is something like: Some_Node* n = new (mem_mgr) Some_Node(...);
00012   // Then, at the end of the program, the memory manager will delete all of the
00013   // allocated nodes that have been passed to it.
00014   // In the future, this class may implement a custom allocator.
00016   template <typename T>
00017   class Memory_Manager {
00018     vector<T*> nodes;
00019 
00020   public:
00021     Memory_Manager(size_t size = 0) : nodes(vector<T*>())
00022     { nodes.reserve(size); }
00023 
00024     ~Memory_Manager()
00025     {
00026       for (size_t i = 0, S = nodes.size(); i < S; ++i) {
00027         // cout << "deleting " << typeid(*nodes[i]).name() << endl;
00028         delete nodes[i];
00029       }
00030     }
00031 
00032     T* operator()(T* np)
00033     {
00034       nodes.push_back(np);
00035       // cout << "registering " << typeid(*np).name() << endl;
00036       return np;
00037     }
00038 
00039     void remove(T* np)
00040     {
00041       nodes.erase(find(nodes.begin(), nodes.end(), np));
00042     }
00043   };
00044 }
00045 
00046 template <typename T>
00047 inline void* operator new(size_t size, Sass::Memory_Manager<T>& mem_mgr)
00048 { return mem_mgr(static_cast<T*>(operator new(size))); }
00049 
00050 template <typename T>
00051 inline void operator delete(void *np, Sass::Memory_Manager<T>& mem_mgr)
00052 {
00053   mem_mgr.remove(reinterpret_cast<T*>(np));
00054   operator delete(np);
00055 }
00056 
00057 #endif
